org.mitre.tdp.boogie.conformance.alg

Class TimeBasedScoreMaximizer<H extends org.mitre.caasd.commons.HasTime,L extends Scorable<H>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.tdp.boogie.conformance.alg.TimeBasedScoreMaximizer<H,L>

  • public class TimeBasedScoreMaximizer<H extends org.mitre.caasd.commons.HasTime,L extends Scorable<H>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The time-based score maximizer takes is built around a collection of Scorable objects but leverages time as the index by which to move through the dynamic programming problem.

    Since it is a maximizer it is looking to find the set of assignments of particular inputs to the provided scorable objects such that over time the overall score is maximized.

    While the DynamicProgrammer can perform both maximization and minimization problems in either direction often one can be rephrased to look similar to one or the other, as such for simplicity in this class we assume a maximization problem.

    Given this is a maximization it's worth noting that this means the best assignments at any given time should be rewarded with a higher score, while transitions with the most likelyhood should be given a larger factor as well.

    Note - When coming up with state and transition scores it's generally best practice to stick to either using percentages everywhere or raw values everywhere.

    E.g. for scoring logic based primarily on distances (e.g. point-leg conformance) either use the raw distances everywhere or use the probability of the object being appropriately assigned to the given leg given its distance away.

      java.util.List<L> legs() 
      java.util.List<Scored<L>> score(java.util.List<H> pts)
      Returns the list of legs from the legs() which together minimize the total cross track error between the points and the available legs.

    • Method Detail

      • legs

        public java.util.List<L> legs()

      • score

        public java.util.List<Scored<L>> score(java.util.List<H> pts)
        Returns the list of legs from the legs() which together minimize the total cross track error between the points and the available legs.

        The returned Scoreds should have both scores as well as start and end times for conformance that have been populated by the output of the dynamic programmers assignments.
